data.name: Meowth

attacks.name: Fake Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It lies around all day, becoming active near dusk. At night, it wanders the city in search of loose change.

data.name: Misty's Wish
rules: Look at 1 of your Prize cards. Then, ask your opponent if you may switch that card with 1 of the cards in your hand. If your opponent accepts and if you have any other cards in your hand, switch those cards. If your opponent declines, return the Prize card face down and draw a card.

data.name: Meowth

attacks.name: Pay Day
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw a card.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.

data.name: Infernape E4 LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Infernape E4. Infernape E4 LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Intimidating Roar
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may have your opponent switch his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Infernape E4 is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Infernape E4.

data.name: Swellow

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Swallow Dive
attacks.text: If this Pokémon used Agility during your last turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.flavorText: If its two tail feathers are standing at attention, it is proof of good health. It soars elegantly in the sky.

data.name: Lunala-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Lunar Javelin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Psychic Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Requiem-GX
attacks.text: (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Misdreavus

attacks.name: Show Off
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Payback
attacks.text: If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It loves to sneak up on people late at night, then startle them with its shrieklike cry.

data.name: Espurr

attacks.name: Twinkle
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: My number one. Exceptionally cute. A little princess.

data.name: Latias ★
rules: You can't have more than 1 Pokémon Star in your deck.

attacks.name: Healing Light
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon (including Latias Star).

attacks.name: Shooting Star
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, discard all Energy cards attached to Latias Star and this attack does 50 damage plus 100 more damage.

data.name: Multi Energy
rules: Attach Multi Energy to 1 of your Pokémon. While in play, Multi Energy provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card when not in play.) Multi Energy provides Colorless Energy when attached to a Pokémon that already has Special Energy cards attached to it.

data.name: Swablu

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It can't relax if it or its surroundings are not clean. It wipes of dirt with its wings.

data.name: Fighting Memory
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Silvally-GX this card is attached to is a Fighting Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Drifloon

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: Drifloon does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.flavorText: Because of the way it floats aimlessly, an old folktale calls it a "Signpost for Wandering Spirits."

data.name: Fairy Garden
rules: Each Pokémon that has any Fairy Energy attached to it (both yours and your opponent's) has no Retreat Cost.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Herdier

abilities.name: Treasure Hunt
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put an Item card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.flavorText: Its dense black fur grows continuously. The high cost of keeping its hard fur properly groomed make this a troublesome Pokémon to train.

data.name: Arceus
rules: You may have as many of this card in your deck as you like.

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.

data.name: Life Dew
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 1 fewer Prize card.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.

data.name: Metal Energy
rules: Damage done by attacks to the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to isn't Metal. Metal Energy provides Metal Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

data.name: Tornadus-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Blow Through
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Power Blast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Latios-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fast Raid
attacks.text: If you go first, you can use this attack on your first turn.

attacks.name: Light Pulse
attacks.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Pokémon Trader
rules: Trade 1 of the Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards in your hand for 1 of the Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards from your deck. Show both cards to your opponent. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Super Scoop Up
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Bidoof

attacks.name: Hyper Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.

data.name: Spinda

attacks.name: Dish Out
attacks.text: Draw a card from the top and the bottom of your deck.

attacks.name: Synchro Punch
attacks.text: If any basic Energy card attached to Spinda is the same type as any Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: No two Spinda have the same pattern of spots. Its tottering step fouls the aim of foes.

data.name: Slakoth

attacks.name: Drowsy
attacks.text: Both Slakoth and the Defending Pokémon are now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It spends nearly all its time in a day sprawled out. Just seeing it makes one drowsy.

attacks.name: Tail Rap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Litwick

attacks.name: Haunt
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and Pokémon, which becomes the fuel that it burns.

data.name: Aegislash

abilities.name: Royal Guard
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 40 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Shield Bash
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Apparently, it can detect the innate qualities of leadership. According to legend, whoever it recognizes is destined to become king.

data.name: Barbaracle

attacks.name: Rock Hurl
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Hand Press
attacks.text: If you have more cards in your hand than your opponent, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.flavorText: Seven Binacle come together to form one Barbaracle. The Binacle that serves as the head gives orders to those serving as the limbs.

data.name: Walrein ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Chilling Breath
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Walrein ex from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may use this power. Your opponent can't play any Trainer cards from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Wreck
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 70 damage plus 20 more damage. Discard that Stadium card.

data.name: Full Heal
rules: Remove all Special Conditions from your Active Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Nincada

attacks.name: Big Bite
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It grows underground, sensing its surroundings using antennae instead of its virtually blind eyes.

data.name: Galarian Slowbro V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Rapid-Fire Poison
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may make your opponent's Active Pokémon Poisoned.

attacks.name: Tripping Shot
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

data.name: Snorlax

attacks.name: Double Lariat
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: When its belly is full, it becomes too lethargic to even lift a finger, so it is safe to bounce on its belly.

data.name: Castform

attacks.name: Weather Teller
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Stadium cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It changes its form depending on the weather. Changes in the temperature or humidity appear to affect its cellular structure.

data.name: Florges

abilities.name: Calming Aroma
abilities.text: Each of your Pokémon's attacks costs Fairy less.

attacks.name: Wonder Shine
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: In times long past, governors of castles would invite Florges to create flower gardens to embellish the castle domains.

data.name: Felicity's Drawing
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Discard up to 2 cards from your hand. If you discard 1 card, draw 3 cards. If you discard 2 cards, draw 4 cards.

data.name: Switch
rules: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Heal Powder
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, your Active Pokémon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned and remove 2 damage counters from it. If your Active Pokémon has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

data.name: Trapinch

attacks.name: Dig
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Its jaws are strong enough to crush rocks but so heavy that it can't get up if it flips over. Sandile seize those moments as their chance.

data.name: Swablu
data.flavorText: It can't relax if it or its surroundings are not clean. It wipes of dirt with its wings.

data.name: Alph Lithograph
rules: LOOK AT ALL OF YOUR FACE DOWN PRIZE CARDS!

data.name: Klefki

abilities.name: Key of Secrets
abilities.text: Each of your Metal Pokémon's Resistance is now -40.

data.flavorText: It never lets go of a key that it likes, so people give it the keys to vaults and safes as a way to prevent crime.

data.name: Volcanion-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Steam Up
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Fire Energy card from your hand. If you do, during this turn, your Basic Fire Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Volcanic Heat
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Regirock ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Healing Stone
abilities.text: At any time between turns, remove 1 damage counter from Regirock ex.

attacks.name: Tonnage
attacks.text: You may do 60 damage plus 20 more damage. If you do, Regirock ex does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Silicobra

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if the Defending Pokémon tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

data.flavorText: It spews sand from its nostrils. While the enemy is blinded, it burrows into the ground to hide.

data.name: Dodrio

attacks.name: Raging Pecks
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. This Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. It runs at nearly 40 mph.

data.name: Tornadus

attacks.name: Energy Wheel
attacks.text: Move an Energy from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hurricane
attacks.text: Move a basic Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.

data.name: Arceus
rules: You may have as many of this card in your deck as you like.

attacks.name: Break Ground
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It is said to have emerged from an egg in a place where there was nothing, then shaped the world.

data.name: Persian

attacks.name: Screech
attacks.text: During your next turn, the Defending Pokémon takes 60 more damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It has a violent temperament. It will attack anything that looks it in the eye. Its sharp claws inflict deep wounds.

data.name: Fossil Excavation Kit
rules: Put 2 in any combination of Helix Fossil Omanyte, Dome Fossil Kabuto, or Old Amber Aerodactyl cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Rock Guard
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if that Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 6 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.

attacks.name: Charm
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It shows its cute side by chasing its own tail until it gets dizzy.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Historically, in the Kalos region, these Pokémon were the designated guardians of the king.

abilities.name: Bright Look

attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your Pokémon, and don't apply Weakness and Resistance to this damage.

attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches the Defending Pokémon with it.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.name: Wooper
data.flavorText: This Pokémon lives in cold water. It will leave the water to search for food when it gets cold outside.

data.name: Lugia ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Silver Sparkle
abilities.text: If Lugia ex is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Lugia ex is Knocked Out), flip a coin. If heads, choose an Energy card attached to the Attacking Pokémon and return it to your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Elemental Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy, Water Energy, and Lightning Energy attached to Lugia ex.

data.name: Cyrus's Conspiracy
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.

Search your deck for a Supporter card, a basic Energy card, and a Trainer card that has Team Galactic's Invention in its name, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Count and Draw
attacks.text: Draw a card for each of your opponent's Pokémon that isn't an Evolved Pokémon.

data.name: Bunnelby

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.flavorText: It has ears like shovels. Digging holes strengthens its ears so much that they can sever thick roots effortlessly.

data.name: Energy Restore
rules: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, put a basic Energy card from your discard pile into your hand. If you don't have that many basic Energy cards in your discard pile, put all of them into your hand.

data.name: Rolycoly
data.flavorText: Most of its body has the same composition as coal. Fittingly, this Pokémon was first discovered in coal mines about 400 years ago.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Resistance Gym
rules: This card stays in play after being played. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Each Pokémon's Resistance is reduced by 20. (If a Pokémon's Resistance is -30, it becomes -10.)

attacks.name: Barrier Attack
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Special Energy attached to it, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Ferocious Bellow
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 50 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Intelligent, good-natured, and valiant, it's a trustworthy partner on rescue teams.

rules: Each player shuffles all cards in his or her discard pile into his or her deck (except for Lysandre's Trump Card).
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

rules: If the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to attacks, the attack does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect unless the Attacking Pokémon is Darkness or has Dark in its name. Darkness Energy provides Darkness Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Haunt

data.name: Blastoise ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Water Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon. Put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Blastoise ex is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, your opponent discards an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Eevee

rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Intense silence. Two lamplights. Keep waiting for night to end.

data.name: Berry
rules: Attach Berry to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.

At any time between turns, if there are at least 2 damage counters on the Pokémon Berry is attached to, you may remove 2 of them and discard Berry. At the start of each turn, if there are at least 2 damage counters on the Pokémon Berry is attached to, remove 2 of them and discard Berry.

data.name: Mewtwo

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Zen Blade
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Zen Blade during your next turn.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon created by recombining Mew's genes. It's said to have the most savage heart among Pokémon.

data.name: Gladion
rules: Look at your face-down Prize cards and put 1 of them into your hand. Then, shuffle this Gladion into your remaining Prize cards and put them back face down. If you didn't play this Gladion from your hand, it does nothing.

data.name: Machamp LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Machamp. Machamp LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if Machamp would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, flip a coin. If heads, Machamp is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP becomes 10 instead.

data.name: Bagon

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: With its steel-hard stone head, it headbutts indiscriminately. This is because of the stress it feels at being unable to fly.

data.name: Scoop Up
rules: Choose 1 of your Pokémon in play and return its Basic Pokémon card to your hand. (Discard all cards attached to that card.)

data.flavorText: It lives in the ozone layer far above the clouds and cannot be seen from the ground.

data.name: Potion Energy
rules: If you play this card from your hand, remove 1 damage counter from the Pokémon you attach it to, if it has any. Potion Energy provides Colorless energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

data.name: Vileplume ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Block Dust
abilities.text: As long as Vileplume ex is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Trainer cards (except for Supporter cards) from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Special Formula
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Eevee

attacks.name: Palette of Friends
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage for each different type of Pokémon on your Bench.

data.flavorText: Possessing an unbalanced and unstable genetic makeup, it conceals many possible evolutions.

data.name: Sabrina's ESP
rules: Attach Sabrina's ESP to 1 of your Pokémon with Sabrina in its name. At the end of your turn, discard Sabrina's ESP. If that Pokémon uses and attack that involves flipping coins, Sabrina's ESP lets you re-flip those coins once. If you do, re-flip all the coins.

data.name: Delcatty

attacks.name: Replace
attacks.text: Move as many Energy attached to your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Play Rough
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: It is highly popular among female Trainers for its sublime fur. It does not keep a nest.

attacks.name: Spearhead
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Nosedive
attacks.text: Farfetch'd does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Diggersby

attacks.name: Mountaintop Mining
attacks.text: You may do 40 more damage. If you do, discard the top 2 cards of your deck.

attacks.name: Rock Cannon
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: As powerful as an excavator, its ears can reduce dense bedrock to rubble. When it's finished digging, it lounges lazily.

data.name: Leftovers
rules: Attach Leftovers to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.
If the Pokémon Leftovers is attached to is your Active Pokémon at the end of your turn, remove 1 damage counter from the Pokémon.

data.name: Genesect

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Breaker Bazooka
attacks.text: Discard all Grass Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.

data.name: Hitmonchan ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Steady Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Sky Uppercut
attacks.text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

data.name: Holon Energy WP
rules: Holon Energy WP provides Colorless Energy.

If the Pokémon that Holon Energy WP is attached to also has a basic Water Energy card attached to it, prevent all effects, excluding damage, done to that Pokémon by your opponent's Pokémon. If the Pokémon that Holon Energy WP is attached to also has a basic Psychic Energy card attached to it, that Pokémon's Retreat Cost is 0. Ignore these effects if Holon Energy WP is attached to Pokémon-ex.

data.name: Electrode ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Extra Energy Bomb
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard Electrode ex and all the cards attached to it (this counts as Knocking Out Electrode ex). If you do, search your discard pile for 5 Energy cards and attach them to any of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) in any way you like. This power can't be used if Electrode ex is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Crush and Burn
attacks.text: You may discard as many Energy as you like attached to your Pokémon in play. If you do, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each Energy you discarded.

data.name: Stoutland

attacks.name: Bite Off
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Wild Barking
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It rescues people stranded by blizzards in the mountains. Its shaggy fur shields it from the cold.

data.name: Trapinch

attacks.name: Inviting Trap
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sand Tomb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It makes a conical pit in desert sand and lies in wait at the bottom for prey to come tumbling down.

data.name: Lycanroc

attacks.name: Stone Edge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: Bathed in the setting sun of evening, Lycanroc has undergone a special kind of evolution. An intense fighting spirit underlies its calmness.

data.name: Moonlight Stadium
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.
The Retreat Cost for each Psychic and Darkness Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) is 0.

data.name: Aurorus-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Frozen Charm
abilities.text: Each of your Pokémon that has any Water Energy attached to it can't be Paralyzed. (If any of those Pokémon are Paralyzed, remove that Special Condition.)

attacks.name: Crystal Breath
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Pidgeot-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mirror Move
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does the same amount of damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Feather Lance
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Crushing Hammer
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Blaine's Quiz #2
rules: Put a card from your hand face down in front of you. Your opponent guesses whether it is an Energy card, a Trainer card, or a Pokémon (Basic or Evolution) card. Flip the card over. If your opponent guessed right, he or she draws 2 cards. If your opponent guessed wrong, you draw 2 cards. Either way, return the card to your hand.

data.name: Delinquent
rules: Discard any Stadium card in play. If you do, your opponent discards 3 cards from his or her hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Gliscor

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!

data.name: Spinda

attacks.name: Staggering Steps
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, this Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Uproar
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: The chances of two Spinda having identical spot patterns is less than one in four billion.

data.name: Professor Sycamore
rules: Discard your hand and draw 7 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Furfrou

attacks.name: Return
attacks.text: You may draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand.

data.flavorText: Historically, in the Kalos region, these Pokémon were the designated guardians of the king.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Triple Spin
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads. If you get 2 or more heads, switch Hitmontop with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, if any.

data.name: Scizor ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Danger Perception
abilities.text: As long as Scizor ex's remaining HP is 60 or less, Scizor ex does 40 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Steel Wing
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Scizor ex by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Cross-Cut
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Sandaconda

attacks.name: Coil
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's attacks do 120 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Its unique style of coiling allows it to blast sand out of its sand sac more efficiently.

data.name: Regigigas LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Regigigas. Regigigas LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Sacrifice
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose 1 of your Pokémon in play and that Pokémon is Knocked Out. Then, search your discard pile for up to 2 basic Energy cards, attach them to Regigigas, and remove 8 damage counters from Regigigas. This power can't be used if Regigigas is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Giga Blaster
attacks.text: Discard the top card from your opponent's deck. Then, choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it. Regigigas can't use Giga Blaster during your next turn.

data.name: M Steelix-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Canyon Axe
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Dunsparce

attacks.name: Double Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Dig
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It creates mazes in dark locations. When spotted, it flees into the ground by digging with its tail.

data.name: Togepi

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It transforms the kindness and joy of others into happiness, which it stores in its shell.

data.name: Pokémon Breeder
rules: Put a Stage 2 Evolution card from your hand on the matching Basic Pokémon. You can play this card only when you would be allowed to evolve that Pokémon anyway.

data.name: Rayquaza-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Intensifying Burn
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 50 more damage.

attacks.name: Dragon Pulse
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck.

data.name: Vaporeon ★
rules: You can't have more than 1 Pokémon Star in your deck.

abilities.name: Blue Ray
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Vaporeon Star from your hand onto your Bench, you may remove all Special Conditions and 3 damage counters from each Active Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Whirlpool
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Onix

attacks.name: Bedrock Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Burrows at high speed in search of food. The tunnels it leaves are used as homes by Diglett.

data.name: Mega Catcher
rules: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Mega Evolution Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Salamence

abilities.name: Dragon Wind
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It flies around on its wings, which have grown in at last. In its happiness, it gushes hot flames, burning up the fields it passes over.

data.name: Meloetta

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Miracle Harmony
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each of your Pokémon in play that has the Sing attack. This attack does 10 damage for each heads to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feels of those who hear it.

data.name: Magearna-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Mystic Heart
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to each of your Pokémon that has any Metal Energy attached to it. (Existing effects are not removed.)

attacks.name: Soul Blaster
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Soul Blaster attack's base damage is 60.

data.name: Togetic

attacks.name: Sweet Kiss
attacks.text: Your opponent draws a card.

data.flavorText: To share its happiness, it flies around the world seeking kind-hearted people.

data.name: Gengar ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Poltergeist
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand. This attack does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Trainer card in your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Prize Count
attacks.text: If you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, this attack does 60 damage plus 40 more damage.

data.name: Gible

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It attacks using its huge mouth. While its attacks are powerful, it hurts itself out of clumsiness, too.

data.name: Charmander

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Charmander.

data.flavorText: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.

data.name: Suicune

abilities.name: Extreme Speed
abilities.text: Suicune's Retreat Cost is Colorless less for each Water Energy attached to Suicune.

attacks.name: Tsunami
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: This Pokémon races across the land. It is said that north winds will somehow blow whenever it appears.

data.name: Rare Candy
rules: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 2 card in your hand that evolves from that Pokémon, put that card on the Basic Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Basic Pokémon that was put into play this turn.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Energy Switch
rules: Move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Bibarel

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Tumbling Tackle
attacks.text: Both this Pokémon and the Defending Pokémon are now Asleep.

data.flavorText: A river dammed by Bibarel will never overflow its banks, which is appreciated by the people nearby.

data.name: Venonat

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Signal Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At nights, its kind is drawn by light.

data.name: Mareanie

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It plunges the poison spike on its head into its prey. When the prey has weakened, Mareanie deals the finishing blow with its 10 tentacles.

data.name: Moo-Moo Milk
rules: Choose 1 of your Pokémon. Flip 2 coins. Remove 2 damage counters times the number of heads from that Pokémon. If the Pokémon has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

data.name: Snorlax LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Snorlax. Snorlax LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Big Appetite
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Snorlax is your Active Pokémon, you may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. If you do, Snorlax is now Asleep. This power can't be used if Snorlax is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Exercise
attacks.text: You may discard as many Energy cards as you like from your hand. If you do, remove that many damage counters from Snorlax.

data.name: Muk

attacks.name: Triple Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. During Pokémon Checkup, put 3 damage counters on that Pokémon instead of 1.

data.flavorText: Because they scatter germs everywhere, they've long been targeted for extermination, leading to a steep decline in their population.

data.name: Life Herb
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your Pokémon, and remove all Special Conditions and 6 damage counters from that Pokémon (all if there are less than 6).

data.name: Trumbeak

attacks.name: Bullet Seed
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: By bending its beak, it can produce a variety of call and brand itself a noisy nuisance for its neighbors.

data.name: Mightyena

attacks.name: Ferocious Bellow
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 50 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It chases down prey in a pack of around ten. They defeat foes with perfectly coordinated teamwork.

data.name: Pokémon Trader
rules: Trade 1 of the Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards in your hand for 1 of the Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards from your deck. Show both cards to your opponent. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: M Pidgeot-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mach Cyclone
attacks.text: You may have your opponent switch his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.
